intro: Castanopsis jianfenglingensis, commonly known as the Jianfengling talaud, is a rare evergreen tree native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island, China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and distinctive cone-like fruits. The plant is adapted to humid, subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect this unique botanical species.
